review_blob: Very skunky aroma that is common with light-stricken beers. The Amarillo hops do a very good job at masking the sorghum off-sweetness that has become infamous amongst G-frees. Appearance is a classic pilsner straw colour. Coming from a gluten-intolerant individual this is a real throwback to the days having a heavily light-struck Stella or Moosehead on a hot day. Until something else comes along Id probably say this is the best Gluten Free beer Ive had.

Appears a nice nut brown colour with a good foamy head. Surprisingly flat and very drinkable. Aroma is very hop forward with a decent malt and maple presence. Good smooth semi-sweet lager. Probably go great with dark barbecue meats. Also left behind some good lacing.

Had this in a wonderful 22oz stein on tap. Beautiful blackish purple colour with a frothy cream head. Very powerful semi-sweet chocolate aroma with a hint of hops. Very rich chocolate dessert like taste followed by a slightly boozy aftertaste. Wonderful night closer.

Had a bottle when I was out for sushi. Pours a nice clear orangey-yellow colour with a fluffy pillow head that flattens out in  few minutes. Nice bread aroma with a traditional easy-going lager mouth feel and taste. Little-no lingering aftertaste. Went very well with a meal.

Poured a wonderful golden orange colour with a diminishing head (may have been the fault of my glassware). Wonderful citra hops aroma with hints of grapefruit. Wonderful bitter, hoppy flavour with a stronger lingering aftertaste. Would love for this to be a regular brew from them!
Tried this one on tap at a hotel bar; perfect blend of bitterness with a light tinge of grapefruit (not too much). Probably one if not the best readily available I.P.A.s in Ontario.

<Bottle - Poured in Tulip Glass> Pours a wonderful copper red colour. Very bitter hoppy aroma with a bit of a fruity aftertaste. Reminds me a lot of the Italian soda Brio. This was actually my first IPA and I was pleasantly surprised. Not the best but certainly noteworthy. Way to go Mill Street!

This is my go-to low carb beer. Nothing special in regards to taste; light fizzy with a bit of flavour... keep it sitting too long and it might taste like flavoured water. A good choice for those with type-1 diabetes or any other carb-restrictive life-style.
I dont know what the fascination is with ice lager is but Im sure the last place to give it a try is on a discount brand. This one almost made me sick.

Laker red is my go-to cheap beer. A staple for Ontarians looking to go local but that is just about where the bus stops. Very bland, familiar red lager flavour, no real distinct body or finish... just throw it back and turn the music up I suppose.
This one had to grow on me. At first it has a familiar coffee-chocolate porter body but is followed by a bittersweet and savoury finish. The more you have it, the more you fall in love with it.
